title: "Database compacting, degraded performance"
body:
My node is running full sync with archive/debug mode, I have 3 questions to ask, please help to explain when convenient, Many thanks in advance!

**1. the sync process is very slow in recent 4 days, about 170k blocks per day.  in the log, there are 3 types of WARN in geth.log, lots of Database compacting, degraded performance, holding on for 1 hour frequently. **How can speed up the sync process?****  

### **running command**
/home/prysm/prysm.sh --checkpoint-sync-url=https:checkpointz.pietjepuk.net --genesis-beacon-api-url=https://checkpointz.pietjepuk.net --execution-endpoint=http://localhost:8551 --mainnet --jwt-secret=/home/prysm/jwt.hex --suggested-fee-recipient= --datadir /home/data/prysm --accept-terms-of-use

geth-1.11.0 --mainnet --syncmode full --gcmode archive --txlookuplimit 0 --http --http.api personal,eth,net,engine,web3,admin,txpool,debug --authrpc.jwtsecret /home/prysm/jwt.hex --datadir /home//data/geth --ws.addr 0.0.0.0 --http.addr 0.0.0.0 --authrpc.addr 0.0.0.0 --bootnodes 



### **SSD usage**
4.0M	./nodes
172M	./ethash
3.9T	./chaindata
1.3G	./triecache
3.9T	.

### **geth attach geth.ipc**
instance: Geth/v1.11.0-unstable-55a92fa0-20221107/linux-amd64/go1.19.2
at block: 9844750 (Fri Apr 10 2020 21:15:49 GMT+0800 (CST))
 modules: admin:1.0 debug:1.0 engine:1.0 eth:1.0 ethash:1.0 miner:1.0 net:1.0 personal:1.0 rpc:1.0 txpool:1.0 web3:1.0

### **geth.log**
WARN [12-06|15:59:04.304] **Database compacting, degraded performance** database=/home/work/hdd1/ethereum/data/geth/geth/chaindata
WARN [12-06|15:59:44.084] **Post-merge network, but no beacon client seen. Please launch one to follow the chain!**
WARN [12-06|16:00:04.315] Database compacting, degraded performance database=/home/work/hdd1/ethereum/data/geth/geth/chaindata
WARN [12-06|16:01:04.326] Database compacting, degraded performance database=/home/work/hdd1/ethereum/data/geth/geth/chaindata
WARN [12-06|16:02:04.335] Database compacting, degraded performance database=/home/work/hdd1/ethereum/data/geth/geth/chaindata
WARN [12-06|16:02:30.526] **Snapshot extension registration failed   peer=3ce52055 err="peer connected on snap without compatible eth support"**
WARN [12-06|16:03:04.344] Database compacting, degraded performance database=/home/work/hdd1/ethereum/data/geth/geth/chaindata
WARN [12-06|16:04:04.362] Database compacting, degraded performance database=/home/work/hdd1/ethereum/data/geth/geth/chaindata
WARN [12-06|16:04:44.114] Post-merge network, but no beacon client seen. Please launch one to follow the chain!


**2. in eth.syncing, healedTrienodeBytes is 0, does this mean no state data synced yet? how long would it expect to sync all the full archive data including state.** 
> eth.syncing
{
  currentBlock: 9851528,
  healedBytecodeBytes: 0,
  healedBytecodes: 0,
  healedTrienodeBytes: 0,
  healedTrienodes: 0,
  healingBytecode: 0,
  healingTrienodes: 0,
  highestBlock: 16121632,
  startingBlock: 5183937,
  syncedAccountBytes: 0,
  syncedAccounts: 0,
  syncedBytecodeBytes: 0,
  syncedBytecodes: 0,
  syncedStorage: 0,
  syncedStorageBytes: 0


**3. in prysm.log, there are two type of error, does it matter?** 
time="2022-12-06 17:23:42" level=info msg="Processing block 0xe3a5193f... 5291168/5291216 - estimated time remaining 22s" blocksPerSecond=2.1 peers=48 prefix=initial-sync
time="2022-12-06 17:24:18" level=warning msg="Block is not processed" error=**"could not process block: could not validate new payload: timeout from http.Client: received an undefined ee error"** prefix=initial-sync
time="2022-12-06 17:24:18" level=info msg="Processing block 0x619924a4... 5291136/5291219 - estimated time remaining 2m46s" blocksPerSecond=0.5 peers=46 prefix=initial-sync
time="2022-12-06 17:24:18" level=info msg="Processing block 0xe3a5193f... 5291168/5291219 - estimated time remaining 24s" blocksPerSecond=2.1 peers=46 prefix=initial-sync
time="2022-12-06 17:24:21" level=error msg=**"Unable to process past deposit contract logs, perhaps your execution client is not fully synced"** error="no contract code at given address" prefix=powchain
Well, if you run gcmode archive, it's _going_ to be heavy on the db. You better have a fast disk and plenty of ram. It will also get worse and worse over time, as the db grows
The slow database compaction is a limitation of leveldb. We have no solution for it at this time, and are exploring alternative databases.
